description.narrative: Himalayan Jan Kalyan Evam Bal Vikas Samiti (HIMVKAS) will spread awareness to and adoption of long term sustainable practices among the community and children to build resilience to variable weather conditions due to climate change. The rises in mean surface temperature and increased incidents of cloudbursts and landslides have damaged climatic conditions that favor the growth of basmati rice and other vegetables in the region. In order to combat these, and other effects of climate change, HIMVKAS will develop a detailed watershed based climate changed adaptation plan for the village of Tilwari. This plan will be publicly shared in order to serve as a template for regional stakeholders including the agriculture, forest, and water departments. HIMVKAS will engage students, farmers, and volunteers from Uttarkhand, India, and internationally to participate in local field action to promote sustainable living practices. Participation in these activities will help to develop relationships with rural producers and consumers, with the goal of increasing participation in community supported agriculture and sustainable livelihoods.
